docs.lead_paragraph: Four-Apple Cider... One of fall's most delightful rewards is apple cider, freshly pressed, fragrant, sweet and thirst-quenching. The more interesting ciders are made from more than one variety of apple. Seik Postma sells a delicious four-apple cider at the Farmers Market in Jamaica, Queens. Made from the apples that grow on his Port Jervis, N.Y., farm, the cider changes as various species ripen. Now it is being made with McIntosh, Red Delicious, Cortland and Macoun apples, and the overriding flavor is that of the not-too-sweet McIntosh. The cider sells for $1.10 a half-gallon and $2 a gallon.
